tasks.task: Installing a sprinkler system through trenching, pipe laying, backfilling, and installing sprinkler heads.
subtasks: Marking trench locations using spray paint or flags.
Checking with local authorities for required materials and contacting 811 before digging.
Digging trenches 6-8 inches deep with a clean bottom and flat surface.
Assembling sprinkler heads and components before placing them in trenches.
Applying primer and cement to pipe joints, ensuring proper connection and fitting placement.
Backfilling trenches while avoiding hitting pipes with shovels and ensuring proper soil compaction.
Installing sprinkler heads with consideration for future adjustments and separate watering needs.
Adjusting nozzle settings for optimal head-to-head coverage and water efficiency.

tasks.task: Laying pipe for a sprinkler system.
subtasks: Selecting appropriate PVC pipe (Schedule 40, Class 200) as per local regulations.
Pre-assembling pipe sections with T's, swing joints, and sprinkler heads.
Cutting pipe sections to length using appropriate tools (e.g., PVC pipe cutters).
Aligning and connecting pipe sections with primer and cement, ensuring proper sealing.
Securing fittings and pipes to prevent movement during backfilling.
Organizing pipes in trenches to minimize the number of trench runs and protect pipes during backfilling.
Maintaining proper soil slope and compaction around pipes and sprinkler heads.
Watering trenches during backfilling to facilitate soil settling and promote grass recovery.
Replacing sod sections and ensuring proper soil density for grass establishment.
Marking the exact location for sprinkler heads using flags or spray paint.
Adjusting trench depth to accommodate sprinkler head height while ensuring level ground.
Assembling and attaching sprinkler heads to pipe connections.
Installing filters and adjusting spray patterns and direction for optimal coverage.
Connecting sprinkler heads to the main pipe line and ensuring proper wiring for controlled irrigation.
Planning trench paths to avoid disrupting existing plants and utilities.
Setting flags or using marking spray to indicate valve and sprinkler head positions.
Removing any existing sod or turf in designated areas.
Covering sensitive areas with protective sheets or fabric to minimize soil disturbance.

tasks.task: Adjusting sprinkler heads for optimal coverage.
subtasks: Testing sprinkler system functionality after installation.
Fine-tuning nozzle settings to achieve even coverage over all planting areas.
Ensuring proper head-to-head coverage between adjacent sprinkler heads.
Adjusting water pressure or sprinkler flow as necessary to prevent water waste.
Using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) when handling tools and materials.
Ensuring all team members are aware of utility markings and avoid digging in those areas.
Using safety equipment when operating power tools (e.g., axe, chainsaw) for root removal.
Observing proper backfilling techniques to prevent soil compaction and pipe damage.
